Welcome to Fraud Detection!

Many frauds are discovered by bank employees (sometimes by accident), rather than FDIC examiners. There is no such thing as a small fraud, just a large fraud caught early. Often, once a fraud has been committed, the perpetrator has no exit plan to discontinue the fraud. Many frauds could have been detected sooner, and bank losses minimized, if examiners had exercised greater professional skepticism during the course of their examination.

This course is intended to hone your discovery skills and professional skepticism, rather than to teach you how to investigate fraud. By focusing on early risk indicators and red flags, we hope this course will make it easier to detect fraud in your everyday work.
